person_421.name: SigmundZois
person_421.description: Wealthy mining magnate in what is now Slovenia. A influential intellectual  and keen amateur mineralogist.

person_143.name: BenjaminThompson
person_143.description: Born in Massachusetts, he served in the British and Bavarian armies. Knighted by George III in 1787, the Elector of Bavaria created him Reichsgraf von Rumford of the Holy Roman Empire in 1792. His appointment in the late 1790s as Bavarian ambassador to London created a minor diplomatic incident, during which he helped establish and manage the Royal Institution, in the course of which he appointed Davy to lecture there. Later he married Lavoisier's widow and lived unhappily ever after. FRSL.

person_784.name: Daniel GabrielFahrenheit
person_784.description: German physicist, inventor, and scientific instrument maker, who invented the mercury-in-glass thermometer. The temperature scale he proposed is named after him. ForMemRSL.

person_368.name: Horace Bénédict deSaussure
person_368.description: Genevan geologist, meteorologist, physicist, mountaineer and Alpine expolorer. Often referred to as the founder of Alpinism and modern meteorology.

person_349.name: Jöns JacobBerzelius
person_349.description: Swedish chemist. He discovered the chemical elements cerium and selenium, and was the first to isolate silicon, thorium, titanium, and zirconium. A rival of Davy's whom he met a few times.

person_183.name: NickolasEsterhazy
person_183.description: Hungarian prince and patron of the arts, especially music. Davy presented him with a copy of Salmonia.

place_216.name: Ljubljana
place_216.description: Also known as Laybach or Laibach. Ljubljana is the capital city of Slovenia.

place_519.name: Trieste
place_519.description: Trieste is the capital city of the Friuli Venezia Giulia region in north-east Italy. A port city, it occupies a thin strip of land between the Adriatic coast and Slovenia’s border on the limestone-dominated Karst Plateau.

place_688.name: Regensburg
place_688.description: Also known as Ratisbon. Regensburg is a city in Bavaria at the confluence of the Danube, Naab, and Regen rivers.

place_898.name: Vienna
place_898.description: Austria’s capital, lies in the country’s east on the Danube River.

place_217.name: River Danube
place_217.description: The Danube is the second longest river in Europe. It flows through central and south eastern Europe into the Black Sea.

place_686.name: Passau
place_686.description: Passau, a German city on the Austrian border, lies at the confluence of the Danube, Inn, and Ilz Rivers. Known as the Three Rivers City, it is overlooked by the Veste Oberhaus, a 13th-century hilltop fortress.

place_687.name: Linz
place_687.description: Linz is a city in Upper Austria, straddling the Danube River midway between Salzburg and Vienna.

place_841.name: Dürnstein Castle
place_841.description: Dürnstein Castle is the ruin of a medieval rock castle in Austria, and where Richard I, English King, was once held captive. It is located in Dürnstein, in the Lower Austrian Wachau region on the Danube River.

place_899.name: Stein
place_899.description: A former municipality in the district of Hartberg-Fürstenfeld in Styria, Austria.

place_1027.name: Hungary
place_1027.description: a landlocked country in Central Europe. Its capital, Budapest, is bisected by the Danube River.

place_165.name: Mont Blanc
place_165.description: Mont Blanc is the highest mountain in the Alps and Western Europe, and the highest mountain in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains.

place_556.name: Eisenerz
place_556.description: Eisenerz is an old mining and market town in the Austrian state of Styria.

place_196.name: Styria
place_196.description: Styria is a state in the south-east of Austria.

place_675.name: St. Gallen
place_675.description: Saint Gallen is a town in the Austrian state of Styria.

place_900.name: Grimming
place_900.description: An isolated peak in the Dachstein Mountains of Austria and one of the few ultra-prominent mountains of the Alps.

place_652.name: Buchstein
place_652.description: Grosser Buchstein is a mountain in Styria, Austria.

place_901.name: Hallein
place_901.description: A historic town in the Austrian state of Salzburg. It is the capital of Hallein district.

place_259.name: Hallstätter See
place_259.description: Hallstatter is a lake in Austria named after the small town on its shore.

place_229.name: Bad Aussee
place_229.description: In Styria (Bad Aussee). Bad Aussee is a town in the Austrian state of Styria located at the confluence of the three sources of the Traun River.

place_902.name: Hallstatt
place_902.description: A village on Lake Hallstatt's western shore in Austria's mountainous Salzkammergut region.

place_085.name: Derbyshire
place_085.description: Derbyshire is a county in the East Midlands and includes part of the Peak District.

place_555.name: Graz
place_555.description: Graz is Austria's second largest city.

place_197.name: Salzburg
place_197.description: Salzburg is an Austrian city on the border of Germany, with views of the Eastern Alps.

place_677.name: Berchtesgaden
place_677.description: Berchtesgaden is a town in Bavaria, close to the border with Austria.

place_317.name: Salza River
place_317.description: The Salza River is an eastern tributary to the Enns River in Lower Austria.

place_329.name: Carinthia
place_329.description: Carinthia is the southernmost Austrian State.

place_680.name: Radstadt
place_680.description: Radstadt is a town in the Austrian state of Salzburg.

place_685.name: New Holland
place_685.description: New Holland was the name first given to Australia by the Dutch seafarer, Abel Tasman.

place_1337.name: Watzmann
place_1337.description: a mountain in the Berchtesgaden Alps south of the village of Berchtesgaden. It is the third highest in Germany, and the highest located entirely on German territory.

place_260.name: Drava River
place_260.description: The Drava is a river in central southern Europe and is the fifth longest tributary of the Danube.

place_427.name: Madelena Grotto
place_427.description: Probably Maddalena Cave, a part of the larger Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

place_181.name: Carniola
place_181.description: The Alpine region whose capital was Laybach (now Ljubljana). In 1827, Carniola was a Duchy within the Austrian Kingdom of Illyria.

place_674.name: Klagenfurt
place_674.description: Klagenfurt is the capital city of the Austrian state of Carinthia.

place_689.name: Hainfeld
place_689.description: Hainfeld is a town in Lower Austria.

place_693.name: Raab
place_693.description: Raab is a town in Upper Austria.

place_261.name: Admont
place_261.description: Admont is a town in the Austrian state of Styria.

place_691.name: Lackenbach
place_691.description: Lackenbach is a town in eastern Austria.

place_692.name: Bovey Formation (Devon)
place_692.description: The Bovey Formation in Devon contains lignite, a poor brown coal with a visibly woody structure.

place_903.name: Kaposvár
place_903.description: A city with county rights in the southwestern part of Hungary, south of Lake Balaton.

place_904.name: Lake Neusiedl
place_904.description: The largest endorheic lake in Central Europe, straddling the Austrian–Hungarian border.

place_695.name: Solfatara di Pomezia
place_695.description: Solfatara di Pomezia is part of a nature reserve near Rome, Italy.

place_780.name: Enns
place_780.description: A tributary of the Danube River, and once a major iron-ore transport route.

place_184.name: Mount Etna
place_184.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

place_199.name: The Colosseum
place_199.description: The Colosseum, the largest amphitheatre ever built, is located in the centre of Rome. Now a ruin, its construction began 2,000 years ago.

place_612.name: Campagna
place_612.description: The Roman Campagna is an area of low-lying countryside surrounding Rome, where both the Tiber and Aniene Rivers flow.

place_156.name: Naples
place_156.description: Naples is the regional capital of Campania in Italy. It is located beneath the volcano, Vesuvius.

place_530.name: Apennines
place_530.description: The Apennines are a range of mountains that run down the spine of peninsular Italy.

place_407.name: Pompeii
place_407.description: An ancient city located in what is now the comune of Pompei near Naples in the Campania region of Italy. Pompeii was buried in volcanic ash in the Eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE.

place_906.name: Caspian sea
place_906.description: The world's largest inland body of water, often described as the world's largest lake or a full-fledged sea.

place_266.name: Rhine
place_266.description: The Rhine is one of Europe's major rivers. It rises in Switzerland, flows through Germany, and enters the North Sea in the Netherlands.

place_704.name: Bay of Naples
place_704.description: The Bay (or Gulf) of Naples is located on the south-western coast of Italy, with Naples to the north, Vesuvius to the east, and the Sorrento Peninsula to the south.

place_1191.name: Mediterranean Sea
place_1191.description: Connected to the Atlantic Ocean and almost completely surrounded by land.

place_908.name: Land's End
place_908.description: A headland in western Cornwall, the most westerly point of mainland England.

place_909.name: Lake Como
place_909.description: A lake of glacial origin in Lombardy, Italy.

place_106.name: Lakes of Killarney
place_106.description: Three lakes (Lough Leane, Muckross Lake - also called Middle Lake, and Upper Lake) surrounded by the MacGillycuddy's Reeks and now part of Killarney National Park.

place_910.name: Celano
place_910.description: A town and comune in the Province of L'Aquila, central Italy.

place_911.name: Niger
place_911.description: The main river of West Africa, extending about 4,180 km.

place_222.name: Africa
place_222.description: The world's second-largest and second-most populous continent.

place_657.name: Canigou
place_657.description: A mountain peak located in the Pyrenees of southern France. Davy made sketches and wrote a poem about The Canigou in notebook 14I.

place_809.name: Pyrénées-Orientales
place_809.description: The Eastern Pyrenees, also known as North Catalonia.

place_823.name: Hungary
place_823.description: The North Hungarian Mountains stretch along the north-easten border of Hungary.

place_698.name: Flanders' Rhine
place_698.description: This is possibly the complex river delta that in corporates the Scheldt and Hollands Diep (the estuary of the Rhine and Meusse Rivers).

place_1204.name: Po Valley
place_1204.description: A vast plain area in Northern Italy, featuring the Po River.

place_169.name: Mount Vesuvius
place_169.description: Mount Vesuvius is a somma-stratovolcano located on the Gulf of Naples in Campania, Italy.
